mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Dr. [Elizur] Butler's statement respecting his interview with Col[onel] Sanford, 1831 June 20, Camp Gilmer, [Murray County, Georgia]

mods:mods.mods:abstract: Statement by Elizur Butler, Christian missionary living in the Cherokee Nation, extracted from a letter dated June 20, 1831. Butler describes a meeting that took place between himself and Colonel Sanford at Camp Gilmer. Colonel Sanford voices his disapproval of missionaries and threatens to imprison Butler again or forcibly remove him and his family if he does not move. Butler states that Samuel Worcester, another missionary to the Cherokee, and himself are intent on staying in the Nation until they are removed by force.
